alert.note: Alert for Inland Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:10PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Harris County through 545 PM CDT... At 509 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Downtown Houston, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and isolated street flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Greater Eastwood, Near Northside Houston, Midtown Houston, Greater Fifth Ward, Downtown Houston, Greater Third Ward, Second Ward, Fourth Ward, Macgregor, Neartown / Montrose, University Place, eastern Greater Heights, Memorial Park, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, southeastern Northside / Northline, Eastex / Jensen Area, Hunterwood, El Dorado / Oates Prairie and Settegast. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
